name: tri-tip madeira bowl
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1.5 lbs Tri-Tip Steak
- 1 bunch Kale, chopped
- 1 cup Basmati Rice
- 1 tbsp Butter or Coconut Oil (for turmeric rice)
- 1/4 Onion, finely diced (for turmeric rice)
- 1 clove Garlic, minced (for turmeric rice)
- 1/2 tsp Turmeric Powder (for turmeric rice)
- 1 1/2 cups Beef Broth (for turmeric rice)
- Salt & Pepper, to taste
- 1 lb Brussel Sprouts, trimmed and halved
- 2 medium Sweet Potatoes, peeled and cubed
- 2 tbsp Olive Oil (for roasting sweet potatoes and brussel sprouts)
- Salt & Pepper, to taste
- Microgreens for garnish

### Mushroom and Peppercorn Madeira Sauce
- 1 tbsp Olive Oil
- 1/2 cup Mushrooms, sliced
- 1 tbsp Fresh Ground Peppercorns
- 1/2 cup Madeira Wine
- 1/2 cup Beef Broth
- 1 tbsp Butter
- 1 tsp Fresh Thyme, chopped
- 1 tbsp Heavy Cream (optional for richness)
instructions:
## Instructions

### Turmeric Rice:
1. In a medium saucepan, heat the butter or coconut oil over medium heat.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, sautéing for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
3. Stir in the turmeric powder and cook for 1 minute to release the spices.
4. Add the basmati rice, beef broth, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
6. Fluff with a fork and set aside.

### Roasted Brussel Sprouts:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Toss the halved brussel sprouts in olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them evenly on a baking sheet.
3. Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until crispy on the edges and tender inside, tossing halfway through.

### Baked Sweet Potato Bites:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C) if you haven’t already.
2. Toss the cubed sweet potatoes in olive oil, salt, and pepper, and spread them out on a baking sheet.
3. Roast for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden and tender.

### Tri-Tip Steak:
1. Preheat a grill or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Season the tri-tip steak generously with salt and pepper.
3. Sear the steak for 4-6 minutes per side, depending on thickness, until it reaches your desired doneness (medium-rare is about 130-135°F or 55-57°C internal temperature).
4. Let the steak rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing against the grain.

### Mushroom and Peppercorn Madeira Sauce:
1. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat and add the sliced mushrooms. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until they begin to release moisture and become golden brown.
2. Add the ground peppercorns and cook for another minute.
3. Pour in the Madeira wine and let it reduce by half, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the beef broth, fresh thyme, and butter, stirring until the sauce thickens. For a richer sauce, stir in the heavy cream.
5. Let the sauce simmer for a few more minutes until it reaches a desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

### Assembling the Bowl:
1. In each bowl, layer the turmeric rice, seasoned kale, roasted brussel sprouts, and baked sweet potato bites.
2. Slice the tri-tip steak and arrange it on top of the bowl.
3. Spoon the mushroom and peppercorn madeira sauce over the steak.
4. Garnish with microgreens for freshness.

name: peanut tofu bowl
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1 bunch Kale, chopped
- 1 cup Almond Wild Rice (or regular wild rice with a handful of almonds, chopped)
- 1 block Firm Tofu, pressed and cubed
- 1/2 Red Cabbage, shredded
- 1 head Broccoli, cut into florets
- 1/4 cup Walnuts, chopped (for pesto)
- 1/2 cup Mushrooms, sliced (for pesto)
- 1/4 cup Fresh Basil (for pesto)
- 1/4 cup Olive Oil (for pesto)
- 1 tbsp Lemon Juice (for pesto)
- 1 Garlic Clove (for pesto)
- Salt & Pepper, to taste
- Microgreens
- 1/2 Mango, diced (for salsa)
- 1/4 Red Onion, finely diced (for salsa)
- 1 tbsp Cilantro, chopped (for salsa)
- 1 tbsp Lime Juice (for salsa)

### Peanut Dressing
- 3 tbsp Peanut Butter
- 1 tbsp Soy Sauce or Tamari (for gluten-free)
- 1 tbsp Lime Juice
- 1 tbsp Honey or Maple Syrup
- 1 tsp Sesame Oil
- 1-2 tbsp Water (to thin, as needed)
- 1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
- 1/4 tsp Ginger Powder
instructions:
## Instructions

### Almond Wild Rice:
1. Rinse the wild rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
2. In a medium saucepan, add the rice, 2 cups of water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil.
3. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40-45 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed.
4. Stir in chopped almonds once cooked, then set aside.

### Roasted Broccoli:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Toss the broccoli florets with olive oil, salt, and pepper, then spread them out on a baking sheet.
3. Roast for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the broccoli is crispy and tender.

### Walnut Pesto Mushrooms:
1. In a skillet, heat a little olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the sliced mushrooms, cooking for 5-7 minutes until softened and browned.
3. Stir in the chopped walnuts and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then set aside.

### Tofu:
1. Press the tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut it into cubes.
2. Heat a non-stick skillet or wok over medium-high heat and add a small amount of oil.
3. Sauté the tofu cubes for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden and crispy on all sides. Season with salt and pepper.

### Mango Salsa:
1. In a bowl, combine the diced mango, red onion, chopped cilantro, and lime juice.
2. Season with salt to taste and stir to combine.

### Peanut Dressing:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, sesame oil, garlic powder, and ginger powder.
2. Gradually add water to thin the dressing to your desired consistency.

### Assembling the Bowl:
1. In each bowl, layer the almond wild rice, seasoned kale, roasted broccoli, walnut pesto mushrooms, and tofu.
2. Add a generous scoop of mango salsa and drizzle with the peanut dressing.
3. Top with microgreens for extra freshness and flavor.

name: mango salmon bowl
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1 bunch Kale, chopped
- 1 cup Quinoa
- 2 Wild Salmon Fillets
- 1/2 Red Cabbage, shredded
- 1 head Cauliflower, cut into florets
- 1 tbsp Olive Oil (for roasting)
- 1/4 cup Walnuts, chopped
- 1/2 cup Mushrooms, sliced
- 1/4 cup Fresh Basil (for pesto)
- 1/4 cup Olive Oil (for pesto)
- 1 tbsp Lemon Juice (for pesto)
- 1 Garlic Clove (for pesto)
- Salt & Pepper, to taste
- Microgreens
- 1/2 Mango, diced (for salsa)
- 1/4 Red Onion, finely diced (for salsa)
- 1 tbsp Cilantro, chopped (for salsa)
- 1 tbsp Lime Juice (for salsa)

### Cashew Cilantro Lime Dressing
- 1/4 cup Cashews (soaked for at least 2 hours)
- 1/4 cup Fresh Cilantro
- 2 tbsp Lime Juice
- 1 tbsp Olive Oil
- 1 tbsp Water (or more for desired consistency)
- 1/4 tsp Salt
- 1/4 tsp Garlic Powder
instructions:
## Instructions

### Quinoa:
1. In a medium saucepan, rinse the quinoa under cold water until the water runs clear.
2. In the same saucepan, add 2 cups of water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil.
3. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 12-15 minutes, or until the quinoa is cooked and the water is absorbed.
4. Fluff with a fork and set aside.

### Roasted Cauliflower:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Toss the cauliflower florets in olive oil, salt, and pepper, then spread them evenly on a baking sheet.
3. Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until golden and tender, flipping halfway through for even roasting.

### Walnut Pesto Mushrooms:
1. In a skillet, heat a little olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the sliced mushrooms, sautéing for 5-7 minutes until tender and browned.
3. Stir in the chopped walnuts and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then set aside.

### Wild Salmon:
1. Preheat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
3. Cook the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, depending on thickness, until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
4. Remove from the heat and set aside to rest for a few minutes before flaking into bite-sized pieces.

### Mango Salsa:
1. In a bowl, combine the diced mango, red onion, chopped cilantro, and lime juice.
2. Season with salt to taste, and stir to combine.

### Cashew Cilantro Lime Dressing:
1. In a blender or food processor, combine the soaked cashews, cilantro, lime juice, olive oil, water, salt, and garlic powder.
2. Blend until smooth, adding more water to reach your desired consistency.

### Assembling the Bowl:
1. In each bowl, layer the quinoa, seasoned kale, roasted cauliflower, walnut pesto mushrooms, and wild salmon.
2. Add a generous spoonful of mango salsa and drizzle with the cashew cilantro lime dressing.
3. Top with microgreens for added freshness and garnish with extra cilantro if desired.

name: thai bowl
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1 bunch Kale, chopped
- 1 cup Basmati Rice
- 1 tbsp Butter or Coconut Oil
- 1/4 Onion, finely diced
- 1 clove Garlic, minced
- 1/2 tsp Turmeric Powder
- 1 1/2 cups Chicken Broth
- Salt & Pepper, to taste
- 2 Chicken Breasts
- 1 Red Bell Pepper, sliced
- 1 Yellow Bell Pepper, sliced
- 1 head Broccoli, cut into florets
- 1 medium Red Onion, sliced
- 2 tbsp Olive Oil
- 1/4 cup Cashews, chopped
- Microgreens
- 1 Carrot, shaved or julienned
- Fresh Cilantro, for garnish

### Thai Sauce
- 1/4 cup Coconut Milk
- 2 tbsp Soy Sauce or Tamari (for gluten-free)
- 1 tbsp Lime Juice
- 1 tbsp Honey or Maple Syrup
- 1 tsp Fish Sauce (optional)
- 1 tsp Sesame Oil
- 1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
- 1/2 tsp Ginger Powder
- 1 tbsp Water (optional for thinning)
instructions:
## Instructions

### Turmeric Rice:
1. In a medium saucepan, heat the butter or coconut oil over medium heat.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, sautéing for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
3. Stir in the turmeric powder and cook for 1 minute to release the spices.
4. Add the basmati rice, chicken broth, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
6. Fluff the rice with a fork and set aside.

### Roasted Veggies:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. On a baking sheet, toss the broccoli florets, sliced bell peppers, and onion with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Roast the vegetables for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized, tossing halfway through.

### Chicken:
1. While the veggies roast, season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and any additional spices you prefer.
2. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat and cook the chicken breasts for 5-6 minutes per side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
3. Remove the chicken from the pan and let it rest before slicing.

### Thai Sauce:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the coconut milk, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, fish sauce (if using), sesame oil, garlic powder, ginger powder, and water.
2. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed, adding more lime juice or honey to balance the flavors.

### Assembling the Bowl:
1. In a bowl, layer the turmeric rice, kale, roasted broccoli, roasted onions, roasted bell peppers, and sliced chicken.
2. Drizzle with the Thai sauce.
3. Top with chopped cashews, shaved carrot, fresh cilantro, and microgreens.

name: rio bowl
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1 can Black Beans
- Microgreens
- 1 Bell Pepper

### Chicken
- 2 Chicken Breasts
- Paprika, Onion Powder, Garlic Powder, Salt, and Pepper

### Turmeric Rice
- 1 tbsp butter or coconut oil
- 1/4 onion, finely diced
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
- 1 c basmati rice
- 1 1/2 c chicken broth
- Salt & pepper, to taste

### Dressing
- 1/4 cup cashews (soaked for at least 2 hours)
- 1/4 cup cilantro, fresh
- 1 jalapeño, seeded and chopped
- 2 tbsp lime juice
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tbsp water (or more for desired consistency)
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp garlic powder
instructions:
## Instructions

### Chicken
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or foil.
4. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
5. Once baked, remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing.

### Turmeric Rice
1. In a medium saucepan, heat the butter or coconut oil over medium heat.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, sautéing for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
3. Stir in the turmeric powder and cook for 1 minute to bloom the spices.
4. Add the basmati rice, chicken broth, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
6. Fluff the rice with a fork and set aside.

### Dressing
1. In a blender or food processor, combine the soaked cashews, cilantro, jalapeño, lime juice, olive oil, water, salt, and garlic powder.
2. Blend until smooth, adding more water as needed to achieve the desired consistency.
3. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.

### Assembling the Bowl
1. In a bowl, layer the turmeric rice, black beans, microgreens, bell pepper slices, seasoned kale, and sliced chicken.
2. Drizzle with the cilantro jalapeno cashew lime dressing.
3. Serve with a scoop of hummus on the side.

name: mediterranean bowl
ingredients:
## Ingredients

- 1 cup quinoa (cooked)
- 1 cup kale (chopped)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil (for sautéing kale)
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- Salt and pepper (to taste)
- 6-8 baked falafel balls
- 2 tablespoons hummus or baba ghanoush
- 1/2 cup microgreens
- 1/2 cup red cabbage (shredded)
instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook the Quinoa:**
   - Rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water.
   - Cook according to package instructions (usually 2 parts water to 1 part quinoa, simmered for about 15 minutes).
2. **Prepare the Kale:**
   - Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
   - Add the chopped kale, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
   - Sauté for 3-5 minutes until the kale is tender but still vibrant.
3. **Bake the Falafel:**
   - Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
   - Place the falafel on a baking sheet and bake according to package instructions or until golden brown and crispy (usually about 20 minutes).
4. **Assemble the Bowl:**
   - Start with a base of cooked quinoa.
   - Add a layer of sautéed kale on one side.
   - Place the baked falafel on top or beside the kale.
   - Add a generous spoonful of hummus or baba ghanoush.
   - Top with shredded red cabbage and microgreens.
5. **Serve & Enjoy!**
   - Drizzle with extra olive oil or your favorite dressing if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy your healthy, protein-packed bowl!

name: chicken harvest bowl
ingredients:
## Ingredients

- Chicken
- Kale
- Almond Wild Rice
- Roasted brocolli & cauliflower
- Sweet Potatos
- Microgreens

### Dressing

- 1 cup fresh cilantro (packed, stems are fine)
- 1/2 cup raw cashews (soaked 15–30 mins in hot water if not using a high-powered blender)
- 1 jalapeño (remove seeds for less heat, leave them in for spice)
- 1 garlic clove
- 2 tablespoons lime juice (1 lime)
- 1/4 teaspoon salt (or to taste)
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin (optional, adds earthiness)
- 1/2 cup water (adjust for thickness)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil (optional, for extra richness)
instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the ingredients:**
   - Cook the chicken until fully cooked and set aside.
   - Rinse and chop the kale, removing any tough stems.
   - Cook the almond wild rice according to package instructions.
   - Roast the broccoli and cauliflower until tender, about 20-25 minutes at 400°F (200°C).
   - Peel and cube the sweet potatoes, then roast them at 400°F (200°C) for 25-30 minutes until soft and lightly caramelized.
2. **Make the dressing:**
   - In a blender or food processor, combine the cilantro, soaked raw cashews, jalapeño, garlic clove, lime juice, salt, and cumin.
   - Add 1/2 cup water and blend until smooth, adjusting the water for your desired dressing thickness.
   - For extra richness, add the olive oil and blend again.
3. **Assemble the bowl:**
   - Start with a base of almond wild rice.
   - Top with chicken, kale, roasted broccoli & cauliflower, and sweet potatoes.
   - Drizzle with the cilantro cashew dressing.
4. **Finish with microgreens:**
   - Garnish the bowl with a handful of fresh microgreens for an extra burst of flavor and nutrients.
5. **Serve and enjoy!**

name: avacado cashew melt
ingredients:
## Ingredients

- 2 whole wheat pita breads (halved or whole, depending on size)  
- 1/2 cup cashew cream (see below)  
- 2 tbsp spicy cashew dressing (see below)  
- 1 ripe avocado, sliced  
- 1 cup fresh spinach  
- 1/2 cup grilled onions (sautéed or grilled)  
- 1/2 cup housemade pesto mushrooms (see below)  
- 2 tbsp lime tomato vinaigrette (see below)  
- Fresh basil leaves for garnish  
- Avocado jalapeño dressing (for drizzling)

### Cashew Cream  
- 1/2 cup cashews (soaked in water for at least 2 hours)  
- 1/4 cup water  
- 1 tbsp lemon juice  
- 1/2 tsp salt  

Blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy.

### Spicy Cashew Dressing  
- 1/4 cup cashew cream  
- 1 tbsp olive oil  
- 1 tbsp lime juice  
- 1 tsp chili flakes (or more for extra heat)  
- 1 garlic clove  
- Salt to taste  

Blend until smooth and adjust seasoning.

### Housemade Pesto Mushrooms  
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms  
- 1 tbsp olive oil  
- 2 tbsp pesto  
- Salt and pepper to taste  

Sauté mushrooms in olive oil over medium heat until tender, then toss with pesto and season with salt and pepper.

### Lime Tomato Vinaigrette  
- 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes (packed in oil, drained)  
- 2 tbsp olive oil  
- 1 tbsp lime juice  
- 1 small garlic clove  
- Salt & pepper to taste  

Blend until smooth and emulsified.
instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prep the pita:**  
   If using whole pita rounds, slice them in half to form pockets, or leave them whole and slice open after grilling.
2. **Assemble the pita:**  
   Spread cashew cream on the inside of the pita, then layer with grilled onions, spinach, pesto mushrooms, and avocado slices.
3. **Dress the pita:**  
   Drizzle with lime tomato vinaigrette and spicy cashew dressing.
4. **Grill the pita:**  
   Heat a skillet or panini press over medium heat. Lightly brush the pita with olive oil and toast until golden and crispy.
5. **Finish and serve:**  
   Drizzle with avocado jalapeño dressing and garnish with fresh basil leaves.
6. **Enjoy!**

name: hot steak melt
ingredients:
## Ingredients

- 2 pita breads (halved or whole, depending on size)  
- 1 lb grilled tri-tip, sliced thinly  
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella  
- 2 tbsp tomato vinaigrette (see below)  
- Cashew cilantro jalapeño dressing (for drizzling)  
- Olive oil for grilling  
- Fresh herbs for garnish (optional: cilantro or parsley)

### Tomato Vinaigrette  
- 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes (packed in oil, drained)  
- 1 tbsp red wine vinegar  
- 2 tbsp olive oil  
- 1 small garlic clove  
- 1/2 tsp honey  
- Salt & pepper to taste  

Blend until smooth and emulsified.
instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prep the pita:**  
   If using whole pita, slice it in half to form pockets, or leave it whole and slice open after grilling.

2. **Assemble the melt:**  
   Spread tomato vinaigrette on the inside of the pita. Layer in the grilled tri-tip slices, mozzarella cheese, and drizzle with a little cashew cilantro jalapeño dressing.

3. **Grill the melt:**  
   Heat a skillet or panini press over medium heat. Lightly brush the pita with olive oil and grill each side until crispy and golden, and the mozzarella is melted.

4. **Finish:**  
   Drizzle with extra cashew cilantro jalapeño dressing and garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley for a burst of freshness.

5. **Serve and enjoy!**

name: chicken caprese melt
ingredients:
## Ingredients

- 2 pita breads (halved or whole, depending on size)  
- 1 cup cooked chicken, shredded or sliced  
- 1/2 cup shredded or sliced fresh mozzarella  
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves  
- 2 tbsp housemade pesto (see below)  
- 2 tbsp tomato vinaigrette (see below)  
- Cashew cilantro jalapeño dressing (for drizzling)

### Housemade Pesto  
- 1 cup fresh basil leaves  
- 1/4 cup toasted cashews or pine nuts  
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan  
- 1 garlic clove  
- 1/4 cup olive oil  
- Salt to taste  

Blend all ingredients until smooth.

### Tomato Vinaigrette  
- 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes (packed in oil, drained)  
- 1 tbsp red wine vinegar  
- 2 tbsp olive oil  
- 1 small garlic clove  
- 1/2 tsp honey  
- Salt & pepper to taste  

Blend until smooth and emulsified.
instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prep the pita:**  
   If using whole pita rounds, slice them in half to form pockets, or leave whole and slice open post-melt.

2. **Assemble the melt:**  
   Spread pesto on the inside of each pita. Layer in chicken, mozzarella, fresh basil, and a spoonful of tomato vinaigrette.

3. **Grill the melt:**  
   Heat a skillet or panini press over medium heat. Lightly brush pita with olive oil and toast each side until the bread is golden and crispy and the cheese is melted.

4. **Finish:**  
   Drizzle with cashew cilantro jalapeño dressing and garnish with extra basil or a few chili flakes if desired.

5. **Serve hot and enjoy!**

name: chicken mahumarra melt
ingredients:
# Ingredients

- 2 pieces of cooked chicken (grilled, roasted, or pan-seared)  
- 1/4 cup muhammara (roasted red pepper and walnut spread)  
- 2 oz goat cheese, crumbled  
- 1 handful mesclun greens (or baby arugula)  
- 2 slices of sourdough bread (or your preferred bread)  
- Olive oil for toasting  
- Optional: A drizzle of balsamic glaze for added sweetness  

### Muhammara  
- 1 cup roasted red peppers (jarred or homemade)  
- 1/4 cup walnuts, toasted  
- 1 clove garlic  
- 1 tbsp olive oil  
- 1 tsp lemon juice  
- 1/2 tsp cumin  
- Salt & pepper to taste  

Blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy.
instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Toast the bread:**  
   Heat a skillet over medium heat and drizzle with olive oil. Toast the slices of sourdough on each side until golden and crispy.

2. **Assemble the sandwich:**  
   Spread muhammara on one slice of toasted bread. Layer the chicken, crumbled goat cheese, and a handful of mesclun greens.

3. **Optional balsamic glaze:**  
   Drizzle a small amount of balsamic glaze over the greens for a sweet and tangy note (if desired).

4. **Finish and serve:**  
   Place the second slice of toast on top, cut the sandwich in half, and serve hot.

name: mango goat cheese salad
ingredients:
## Ingredients

- Arugula  
- Red Cabbage  
- Mango  
- Grape Tomato  
- Goat Cheese  
- Slivered Almond  
- Basil  

## Dressing

- 3 tbsp olive oil  
- 1 tbsp honey  
- 1 tbsp lime juice  
- 1 tsp dijon mustard  
- 1 clove garlic, finely grated  
- Salt & black pepper to taste  
- Optional: a pinch of chili flakes for heat  

### Chicken

- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts  
- Zest of 1 lime  
- Juice of 1 lime  
- 1 tbsp olive oil  
- 1 tsp honey  
- 1/2 tsp chili powder  
- 1/4 tsp smoked paprika  
- Salt & pepper to taste
instructions:
## Instructions

- **Cook the chicken:**  
  Marinate the chicken in lime zest, lime juice, olive oil, honey, chili powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper for at least 20 minutes (up to 2 hours for deeper flavor). Grill or pan-sear over medium heat until golden and cooked through. Let rest, then slice thinly.

- **Make the dressing:**  
  Whisk together olive oil, honey, lime juice, dijon mustard, garlic, salt, pepper, and chili flakes (if using) until emulsified.

- **Assemble the salad:**  
  Toss arugula, shredded red cabbage, mango slices, grape tomatoes, goat cheese crumbles, and slivered almonds. Add sliced chicken and fresh basil. Drizzle with dressing and toss gently.

- **Plate and enjoy!**

name: protein avacado crisp salad
ingredients:
## Ingredients

- mesclun
- kale
- chicken
- egg
- avacado
- parmesan crisp
- grape tomatoe
- red onion

### Dressing

- 1 cup fresh cilantro (packed, stems are fine)
- 1/2 cup raw cashews (soaked 15–30 mins in hot water if not using a high-powered blender)
- 1 jalapeño (remove seeds for less heat, leave them in for spice)
- 1 garlic clove
- 2 tablespoons lime juice (1 lime)
- 1/4 teaspoon salt (or to taste)
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin (optional, adds earthiness)
- 1/2 cup water (adjust for thickness)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil (optional, for extra richness)

### Chicken

- 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- Juice of 1/2 lime
instructions:
## Instructions

- Cook the chicken
- Make the dressing
- Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl
- Plate and enjoy!

### Dressing

1. If you’re not using a high-speed blender, soak the cashews in hot water for 15–30 minutes, then drain.
2. Add all ingredients to a blender or food processor.
3. Blend until completely smooth. Add more water 1 tbsp at a time if it’s too thick.
4. Taste and adjust: more salt or lime juice if needed.

### Chicken

1. Pat the chicken dry and pound slightly for even thickness.
2. In a bowl, mix olive oil, garlic powder, smoked paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, and lime juice.
3. Rub the spice mixture all over the chicken and let it marinate for at least 15 minutes (up to overnight for more flavor).
4. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat.
5. Cook chicken for 5–6 minutes per side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) and it has a nice sear.
6. Let rest for 5 minutes, then slice thinly across the grain.

name: white bean chicken chili
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1 small yellow onion, diced
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 (14.5 oz) cans chicken broth
- 1 (7 oz) can diced green chilies
- 1 tsp cumin
- 1/2 tsp paprika
- 1/2 tsp dried oregano
- 1/2 tsp ground coriander
- 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper
- Salt & pepper (freshly ground), to taste
- 1 (8 oz) package light cream cheese, cut into cubes
- 1 can corn
- 2 cans cannellini beans
- 1 tbsp fresh lime juice
- 2 tbsp chopped cilantro
- Tortilla chips, Monterrey jack cheese, and avocado for serving
- 1 Rotisserie Chicken
instructions:
## Instructions
- Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion & saute 4 mins. Add garlic & saute 30 seconds longer.
- Add chicken broth, green chilies, and all spices to pot. Bring mixture just to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low & simmer 5-10 mins.
- Drain and rinse beans & corn. Transfer one can’s worth of beans to a food processer/blender along with about 1/2 c broth from soup. Puree until smooth.
- Add cream cheese, corn, remaining beans, & blended mixture to soup. Simmer 5 mins.
- Stir in fresh lime juice & cilantro. Serve with toppings.
- Carve up the rotisserie chicken and add to the soup

name: double meat healthy chilli
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 2 tbsp canola oil
- 1 large yellow onion, finely diced
- 1.5 lb extra lean hamburger meat or seitan
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 2 small zucchinis, diced
- 1 can corn kernels, drained
- 1 can black beans, drained
- 1 can pinto beans, drained
- 1 (28 oz) plus 1 (14 oz) can diced tomatoes with juices
- 1/2 c water (more if desired)
- 1/4 c dark brown sugar
- 2 heaping tsp fajita spice
- 1 tsp cumin
- 1/4 tsp cayenne
- 1/8 tsp cinnamon

### For Serving
- Cheddar cheese, grated
- Sour cream
- Cilantro, chopped
- Tortilla chip strips
- Avocado, diced
instructions:
## Instructions
- In a large pot over medium-high heat, warm canola oil. Add onions and saute until translucent and lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
- Add ground hamburger and saute until lightly browned, about 8-10 minutes.
- Add red bell pepper and zucchini and cook for 5 minutes.
- Add corn, beans, tomatoes, water, and brown sugar; stir well. Add fajita spice, cumin, cayenne, and cinnamon; stir well.
- Reduce heat to low; partially cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until thick and soupy. Cook longer if you like your vegetables softer. If desired, sprinkle with a little cheddar cheese and fresh cilantro before serving.

name: black bean salmon and rice
ingredients:
## Ingredients

### Black Beans
- 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, undrained ￼
- 1/2 cup chopped red or green bell pepper ￼
- 2 teaspoons instant minced onion ￼
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin ￼
- 1 teaspoon chili powder ￼
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder ￼
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
### Mango Mustard Sauce:
- 1 cup sliced mango ￼
- 1 1/2 tablespoons cider vinegar ￼
- 1 1/2 tablespoons Dijon mustard ￼
- 1/8 teaspoon garlic powder ￼
- Dash of salt and pepper ￼

### Salmon:
- 4 salmon fillets ￼
- Salt and pepper, to taste

### For Serving:
- 3 cups cooked white sticky rice ￼
instructions:
## Instructions

### Prepare the Salmon

- Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper. ￼
- Grill or bake at 425°F (218°C) for 10 minutes per inch of thickness, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. ￼
- Keep fillets warm.

### Prepare the Black Beans

- Drain the black beans, reserving 1/3 cup of the liquid. ￼
- In a saucepan, combine the beans, reserved liquid, bell pepper, minced onion, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, and salt.
- Cook over low heat for 5 minutes.
- epare the Mango Mustard Sauce:
- In a food processor, blend mango, cider vinegar, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until smooth or slightly chunky, based on preference. ￼
- Transfer to a microwave-safe dish and heat for 1-2 minutes until warm.

### Assemble the Dish

- On each plate, spoon a portion of the black beans.
- Place a salmon fillet on top of the beans.
- Drizzle with the warm mango mustard sauce.
- Serve alongside white sticky rice.

name: mango banana leaf halibut
ingredients:
## Ingredients:

- 12 green onions
- 1/4 cup minced garlic ￼
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro (packed) ￼
- 4 kaffir lime leaves ￼
- 4 tablespoons vegetable oil ￼
- 3 tablespoons red curry paste
- 1 tablespoon paprika
- 1 (13.5-ounce) can coconut milk ￼
- 1 tablespoon sugar ￼
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce ￼
- 6 halibut fillets ￼
- Juice of one lemon
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 6 sections of banana leaves (found in the frozen section of Asian markets) ￼
- Aluminum foil
instructions:
## Instructions

### Prepare the Curry Sauce

- Remove the woody spines from the kaffir lime leaves.
- In a food processor, blend green onions, garlic, cilantro, and lime leaves into a paste.
- Sauté the paste in vegetable oil over medium-high heat for several minutes until fragrant.
- Add red curry paste and paprika; cook for another couple of minutes.
- Spoon off the thick cream from the top of the coconut milk can; add the remaining liquid to the pan.
- Stir in sugar and fish sauce; bring to a boil, then simmer until slightly thickened.

### Prepare the Fish Packets: ￼

- Rinse halibut fillets and pat dry. ￼
- Place each fillet on a section of banana leaf set atop a piece of aluminum foil.
- Season with salt, pepper, and a generous sprinkle of lemon juice.
- Spoon enough curry sauce over each fillet to cover.
- Fold the banana leaf over the fish, then wrap securely with aluminum foil to form a packet.
- Let the packets marinate for 30 minutes (up to 4 hours).

### Cook the Fish:

- Preheat the oven to 450°F (232°C).
- Place the foil-wrapped packets on a baking sheet.
- Bake for 14 minutes, adjusting time for thicker fillets as needed.

### Serve:

- Unwrap the packets and serve the fish over hot steamed rice. ￼
- Spoon additional curry sauce over the top before serving.

name: protien balls
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1/2 c peanut butter
- 1/4 c honey (or date syrup or coconut syrup)
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/3 c protein powder
- 1/3 c flaxseed meal
- 1/2 c rolled oats
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tbsp chia seeds
- 1 tbsp mini chocolate chips
- Opt: 1/4 c shredded coconut
instructions:
## Instructions
- In the bowl of a food processor, add in the peanut butter, honey, vanilla, protein powder, flaxseed meal, oats, cinnamon and chia seeds. Pulse together until well combined. Add in chocolate chips (and coconut if using) and pulse a few more times. Use a medium cookie scoop or your hands to grab dough and roll into 10 balls, place in an airtight container.
- To make without food processor: add wet ingredients to a medium bowl, mix to combine. Add in dry ingredients and mix together until combined. I usually have to use my hands to mix and work with the dough. At this point you should be able to form balls that stick together. Because all peanut butter/nut butter consistencies are different and depending on what protein powder you use, you may need to add in more nut butter or sweetener to help the balls stick together.
- Store in the fridge for up to 1 week, or the freezer for up to 2 months. Enjoy!

name: vodka sauce pasta
ingredients:
## Ingredients
- 1/2 box (8 oz) rotini (save pasta water)
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 small/medium onion, diced
- 1 tbsp minced garlic
- 1 tsp red pepper flakes
- 1 tbsp tomato paste
- 1 tbsp butter
- 1 tbsp vodka
- 1/2 c heavy cream
- 1/2 c shredded parmesan
- 1 tsp paprika
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- salt & pepper to taste
- Basil

### Chicken
- 1 large chicken breast
- Garlic Powder
- Onion Powder
- Salt 
- Pepper
- Paprika
- Olive Oil
- Butter
instructions:
## Instructions
- Make pasta & save 1 cup pasta water.
- In big skillet, add olive oil & heat pan to med-high. Add onion, red pepper flakes, & garlic. Saute until fragrant.
- Add tomato paste, butter, vodka, & cream. Heat for 2-3 mins, stirring constantly. Reduce heat if pan gets too hot.
- Add parmesan & mix until melted, then start adding pasta water to thin sauce.
- Heat sauce on low-med for 5 mins so sauce can thicken a little. Add remaining spices. When sauce is done, add pasta. Serve with parmesan & basil.
- Serve with sliced chicken

### Chicken
- Coat each side of the chicken breast with salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder
- Heat a cast iron skillet and poor a few tablespoons of olive oil in the pan with some butter
- Cook the chicken breasts for a few minutes on each side, or until an internal temperature of 165.
